name: Half-Life Deathmatch: Source
description: Half-Life Deathmatch: Source is a recreation of the first multiplayer game set in the Half-Life universe. Features all the classic weapons and most-played maps, now running on the Source engine.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® 7 (32/64-bit)/Vista/XP Processor: 1.7 GHz Processor, requires support for SSE Memory: 1024 MB RAM DirectX: Version 8.1 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: i always wondered what the source of hl2dm was

It's basically Half-Life, but in Free-for-all form. All the weapons from Half-Life are in here.  This game is DEAD though. So if you can host a private server and get a couple of your friends to play, then this game is awesome!  Great for fans of the original Half-Life. Not so good for people who just wanna play. There are much more people playing the original Half-Life Deathmatch and not the Source 'remake' version. Just don't expect to find anyone playing on a Public server.

It just appeared in my library and I didn't know what to do, so I played it.  And how grateful I am that I did, it's gameplay is simple, but still fun, there isn't anything competitive and it just feels like a breath of fresh air from highly competitive games like LoL, Dota, CS and COD. Playing this felt so good and refreshing with no one raging or hacking and there isn't even voice chat to bear risk of driving everyone mad. The 15 or so people that play this game come and go, being happy and silent as the familiar scramble to the nearest weapon becomes a new chalenge of getting those guns off the person who has the most.  Classic Deathmatch the way it should be, to be played casually or religiously, 10/10

The very definition of 'non-comittal gaming'. Death is of little consequence here and the frantic pace on even a medium size server will stop you caring when you do face the wrong end of someone's firearms. Buying this now will have the two-faced taint of 'retro' all over it. But don't let that dissuade you, its still a blissfully uncomplicated example of the Multiplayer FPS genre.

A fun, simple deathmatch mode using areas, weapons, and characters from Half Life 1. This is Source so many things look and run better. Weapons are scattered throughout the map and you can carry as many as you like until you die, in which case you'll respawn instantly ready for more. Games are hectic and weapons run out of ammo fairly quickly which encourages moving around as opposed to camping in one spot.

It was great before the SteamPipe Update. But Valve broked it at that time, and we're in 2016, and they still didn't fixed it, so it's full of bugs. By the way, it's same as the original Half-Life's deathmatch mode, but it's engine is Source Engine, so you get ragdoll physics, more realistic skybox, particle effects, decals, water and lightning, so don't expect some major improvements.
A game made at a time when Valve felt the sky was the limit with the Source engine  So they made this and everyone was like, 'Why?'
